King Tut's remains. They broke a statue of a panther and several others, according to a previous report in The Epoch Times. Reuters reported that the looters also damaged some mummies. All of the museums in Egypt, 24 in total, are safe and unharmed; only the Egyptian Museum, Cairo, was broken into, reads a Wednesday posting on the website of Zahi Hawass , Egypt's Minister of Antiquities. Boomer doesn't question George H.W. Bush 's judgment However, Boomer stressed that he talked about George H.W. Bush 's command with reluctance. "I truly believe that Monday morning quarterbacking is easy," Boomer stressed. I did not question the George H.W. Bush 's judgment then, nor do I now. "We should presume that he made an informed and thoughtful decision. "That's the way I feel about it. In his memoirs, Norman Schwarzkopf stated "I don't have any problem with it" when informed by Colin Powell that George H.W. Bush was prepared to stop the war.
